page.title: 03HOUSING BUTTERFURLONG
page.content: The Hewetts and the Marshalls houses are joined together all across except for a square courtyard in the middle,which has a pump in.The pump is the same age as the houses.A lady died in the well beneath the pump in the 1930s but it is not known whether she fell,was pushed down or committed suicide.Butterfurlong Cottages and Farm are pleasantly situated near West Grimstead.Someway up a nearby track is a pig farm.It is on three sides surrounded by fields and one side by woods.Both cottages are thought to be about 150 years old.They used to be a tied cottage for Butterfurlong Farm.In 1965 the cottages were remodernized.The Marshalls and the Hewetts gardens both cover approximately one fifth of an acre.Both houses are made of brick and both roofs are clay tiles.
